messages.title: Change in Keighley and Ilkley
messages.content: The re-election of Gordon Brown's government will mean debt, waste and more tax.

messages.title: Labour's Tax on Jobs Will Kill the Recovery
messages.content: Labour's policies will increase National Insurance, putting jobs at risk and hampering economic recovery.

messages.title: Backing the NHS
messages.content: The NHS is the Conservative's number one priority, promising investment and reduction of bureaucracy.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stopping the increase in National Insurance by the Labour government.
Make the NHS the top priority with increased investment and reductions in bureaucracy.

mentions.candidate: Kris Hopkins working hard in the local area, his planned improvements for the community, and his pledge for a 'referendum on the European Union'.

issues.brexitEurope: Pledging a referendum on the European Union
issues.economy: Opposition to Labour's planned increase in National Insurance.
issues.health: Investing in and streamlining the NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: Protecting winter fuel payments, free prescriptions, bus fares for the elderly.

housing.content: Conservatives will fight plans to build more homes on the Green Belt.

leaflet.personalStatement: 'My challenge to the community is simple â€“ if you genuinely care for the health and prosperity of your community, take the 'patriotic' English view which truly speaks for yourselves.'

quotes.text: Kris is listened to with respect by Ministers and brings a wealth of experience to help solve your problems.

images.caption: Photos of Kris Hopkins with various individuals, including David Cameron, and within the local community.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasises Kris Hopkins' work within the local community, his association with the then Conservative Party leader David Cameron, and his opposition to Labour's economic policies.
